get_summary_stats

Source: R/utils.R
get_summary_stats.Rd

Compute all relevant summary statistics given a dataframes of all numerical columns.

Usage

get_summary_stats(data)

Arguments

data

a dataframe

Value

a dataframe

Examples

X <- sim_clust(2, 100, dmin = 0.5, rmin = 0.3, nind = 10)
get_summary_stats(X)
#>                    x1          x2          x3          x4          x5
#> mean     -0.219869895 -0.21213274 -0.11008704  0.26809607 -0.37312227
#> sd        1.085736519  0.95896812  0.96080637  0.89695384  1.01414537
#> min      -3.886350389 -2.53281999 -3.42269020 -1.91139997 -2.84982605
#> max       1.796381371  2.77246728  2.06824154  2.29603938  1.97662449
#> skewness -0.429151925  0.03924592 -0.29561637  0.06423351  0.04167754
#> kurtosi  -0.008271004  0.17452028  0.40027750 -0.48998737 -0.30987670
#> q25      -0.959919002 -0.82190563 -0.75260003 -0.38195694 -1.02435886
#> q50      -0.137495019 -0.18961004 -0.08939608  0.20125344 -0.41173766
#> q75       0.599761827  0.33608445  0.49890045  1.02885613  0.26784435
#>                  x6         x7          x8         x9         x10      group
#> mean     -0.1799911 -0.1962656  0.28681730 -0.2994537 -0.17051131  1.5000000
#> sd        0.9268906  0.9952760  0.95297098  1.0558729  0.96823252  0.5025189
#> min      -2.4329398 -2.4052683 -2.03200994 -2.6045769 -2.43702861  1.0000000
#> max       2.1743475  2.3672723  2.33934142  2.1823567  2.51187491  2.0000000
#> skewness -0.1878010  0.1129082  0.08667221  0.1089482  0.19019764  0.0000000
#> kurtosi  -0.4731039 -0.4493069 -0.57300184 -0.7711314 -0.26207426 -2.0199000
#> q25      -0.7899135 -0.9905953 -0.34698270 -1.1368743 -0.87056719  1.0000000
#> q50      -0.1345758 -0.1898925  0.20785203 -0.2353589 -0.06684256  1.5000000
